page.title: 15PENALLT W. I. (nr. LYDART)
page.content: The Penallt branch of the Womens Institute was formed in 1963,and at present has 39 members,ranging in age from 20 to over 80. We have as wide a range of interests as we have members; we arrange theatre visits,trips to stately homes,cookery demonstrations,and concern ourselves particularly with Third World affairs. This year,1985,we have raised nearly Â£200 for the African famine appeal, and have helped to provide water supplies for women in the Maldives. We meet once a month in Pelham Hall, and attract members from Penallt, Lydart and Trellech. Our meetings start with a short business session followed by an outside speaker and end with tea and gossip! We send a representative to as many outside W.I. functions as possible,and also to the W.I.'s Denman College.
